related_questions.question: Who built the first solar panel?
related_questions.snippet: Almost 50 years after the photovoltaic effect's discovery, in 1883, American inventor Charles Fritz created the first working selenium solar cell. related_questions.question: Where was solar energy first used?
related_questions.snippet: 1954 Photovoltaic technology is born in the United States when Daryl Chapin, Calvin Fuller, and Gerald Pearson develop the silicon photovoltaic (PV) cell at Bell Labs—the first solar cell capable of converting enough of the sun's energy into power to run everyday electrical equipment.

related_questions.question: Where does the solar energy come from?
related_questions.snippet: The sun has produced energy for billions of years. Solar energy is the solar radiation that reaches the earth. Solar energy can be converted directly or indirectly into other forms of energy, such as heat and electricity.

answer_box.title: How long has solar power been around and does it work ...
answer_box.snippet: Solar PV (photovoltaic) was first discovered in 1839 by French scientist Edmond Becquerel. Over the next 100 years, there were other discoveries and inventions, including several discoveries by Albert Einstein, who received a Nobel Prize for his theories on the photovoltaic effect in 1921.
